title: A Hew and cry after blood & murther: or an elegie on the most barbarous murther of Thomas Thinn, esq with some thankful ejaculations to heaven, for the miraculous escape of his Grace the Duke of Monmouth from the hands of the bloody Russians
notes: Verse: Whil'st with hot scent; the Popish-Tory Crew.
Reproductions of the originals in the Harvard University Library and British Library.
